ab.title: Genesis 32
ab.l: And early in the morning Laban rose up and kissedhis sons and his daughters and blessed them. And Laban departed and returnedto his place.
And Jacob went on his way, andthe angels of God met him.
And Jacob said, whenhe saw them, ‘This is God’s camp!’ So he called the name ofthat place Mahanaim.Parashat Vayishlach
And Jacob sent messengersbefore him to Esau his brotherin the land of Seir, to the plain of Edom.
And he commandedthem, saying, ‘Thus shall you say to my lord Esau: “Thus saidyour servant Jacob, “I have sojourned with Laban, and stayed there until now.
And I have bulls, and donkeys, flocks, and servants, andmaidservants. And I have sent to tell my lord so as to find favour in your eyes.””’
And the messengers returned to Jacob,saying, ‘We came to your brother Esau, and also he is comingto meet you, and four hundred men with him.’
AndJacob was very afraid and distressed. And he dividedthe people that were with him, and the flocks, andthe cattle, and the camels, into two camps.
Andhe said, ‘If Esau comes to the one camp, and smites it,then the other camp which is left shall escape.’
AndJacob said, ‘Oh God of my father Abraham, and Godof my father Isaac, the Lord who said to me, “Return to your country,and to your kindred, and I will deal well with you,”
I became too smallfor all the mercies, and for all the truth, which you have done to your servant,because I crossed this Jordan with |just| my staff, and nowI have become two camps.
Deliver me, I pray you,from the hand of my brother, from the hand of Esau, because I fear him,lest he will come and kill me, and kill the mother with the children.
And you said, “I will surely do well with you,and I will make your offspring like the sandof the sea, that it will not be countable because of its multitude.”’
And he stayedthere that night. And he took of that which came to his hand an offering for Esauhis brother:
Two hundred |female| goats, and twenty male goats,two hundred ewes, and twenty rams,
thirty milking camels with their calves, forty heifers,and ten bull calves, twenty |female| donkeys, and ten male donkeys.
And he gave them to the hand of his servants, every drove separately,and said to his servants, ‘Pass over before me, and put a spacebetween each drove.’
And he commanded the first,saying, ‘If Esau my brother meets you, and asksyou, saying, “Whose are you? And where are you going? And whose arethese before you?”
then you shall say, ‘They are your servant Jacob’s.It is a present sent to my lord Esau. And, lo, he himselfcomes behind us as well.”’
And he also commanded the second,also the third, also all that followedthe droves, saying, ‘You shall speak like thisto Esau, when you find him,
And say,“Lo, your servant Jacob comes behind us as well.”’ Because he said, ‘I will soothehis anger with the offering that goes before me, and afterwardI will see his face; maybe he will favour me.’
And the offering passed before him. Andhe stayed that night in the camp.

And he rose up that night,and took his two wives, and his two maidservants, andhis eleven sons, and crossed the ford –seg type="commented" n="#seg021"/a place on the river calledanchor type="commented" xml:id="seg021"/ Jabbok.
And he tookthem, and made them cross the river, and he made pass |all|that was his.
And Jacob was left alone.And there fought an angel with him until the dawn’s rising.
And he saw that he was not able to prevail against him, and he touched the jointof his thigh, and the joint of Jacob’s thigh was movedduring his fighting with him.
And the angel said,‘Let me go, because the dawn has risen.’ Andhe said, ‘I will not let you go, except if you blessme.’
And he said to him, ‘What is your name?’ And he said,‘Jacob.’
And he said, ‘Your name will not be saidJacob, only, any more, but also Israel, because you were like a ruler with angeland with men, and you have prevailed them.’
AndJacob asked him, and said, ‘Tell me your name.’ And he said,‘Why is this that you ask my name?’ And he blessed him there.
And Jacob called the name of the place Peniel: ‘Because I have seenthe angel mind to mind, and my life has been delivered.’
The sun shone on him as he passed Penuel,and he was limping on his thigh.
On account of thisthe people of Israel to this day do not eat the sinew of the thighthat is on the joint of the thigh, because the angel touchedthe joint of Jacob’s thigh, the sinew of the thigh.

app.note: K: Gen 32:1 is copied as Gen 31:55; a scribal error.
